x+y.description: Basic charts that display one variable against another in a standard coordinate system
x+y.suitable_for: Visualizing direct relationships, comparing values across categories, showing trends, or displaying distributions

chart_types.name: Line Graph
chart_types.best_for: Visualizing continuous data changes over time, showing trends, and highlighting patterns in sequential data

chart_types.name: Spline Graph
chart_types.best_for: Showing smooth continuous trends with curved lines for a more fluid visualization of data progressions

chart_types.name: Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Emphasizing the magnitude of changes over time while highlighting the area under a trend line

chart_types.name: Vertical Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing discrete categories by their magnitude with clear visual distinction between individual values

chart_types.name: Horizontal Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing values across categories with long labels or numerous categories for better readability

chart_types.name: Triangle Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Adding visual interest to standard bar comparisons while maintaining the ability to compare magnitudes

chart_types.name: Pictorial Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Enhancing engagement by using themed shapes or icons instead of standard bars while preserving data accuracy

chart_types.name: Dot Chart
chart_types.best_for: Creating minimal, clean displays of category values using dots instead of bars, reducing visual noise

chart_types.name: Scatter Plot
chart_types.best_for: Examining correlation between two continuous variables, identifying patterns, clusters, or outliers

chart_types.name: Pie Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing part-to-whole relationships with relatively few categories (ideally â‰¤7), emphasizing proportions

chart_types.name: Donut Chart
chart_types.best_for: Displaying part-to-whole relationships while providing space in the center for additional information

chart_types.name: Semi Circle Donut Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing proportional composition in a space-efficient format while preserving the part-to-whole relationship

chart_types.name: Proportional Circle Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing quantities across categories using circle area, creating intuitive size-based comparisons

chart_types.name: Proportional Square Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing quantities using square areas, providing more accurate area perception than circles

chart_types.name: Proportional Icon Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Using themed icons sized proportionally to represent quantities, adding contextual meaning to comparisons

chart_types.name: Pictorial Unit Chart
chart_types.best_for: Representing discrete quantities with repeated icons where each icon represents a specific unit count

chart_types.name: Histogram
chart_types.best_for: Visualizing the distribution of a continuous variable by showing frequency within defined bins or intervals

x+y+group.description: Charts that display multiple series of data or group values by categories
x+y+group.suitable_for: Comparing trends, patterns, or compositions across different categories or groups over time

chart_types.name: Multiple Line Graph
chart_types.best_for: Comparing trends over time across multiple categories, highlighting convergence, divergence, or similar patterns

chart_types.name: Multiple Spline Graph
chart_types.best_for: Comparing smooth trends across multiple series with curved lines, emphasizing continuity and flow

chart_types.name: Multiple Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing magnitudes across multiple series while emphasizing the area under each trend line

chart_types.name: Layered Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Displaying multiple overlapping series where transparency helps visualize individual and combined trends

chart_types.name: Stacked Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing how parts contribute to a whole over time while preserving the ability to see total values

chart_types.name: Stream Graph
chart_types.best_for: Displaying changing composition over time with flowing, organic shapes emphasizing relative contributions

chart_types.name: Vertical Grouped Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing values across categories and subcategories simultaneously, facilitating both within-group and between-group comparisons

chart_types.name: Horizontal Grouped Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing grouped values across categories with long labels, providing better readability than vertical arrangement

chart_types.name: Vertical Stacked Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing both total values and the composition of those values across categories in a vertical format

chart_types.name: Horizontal Stacked Bar Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing composition within categories with long labels, emphasizing part-to-whole relationships horizontally

chart_types.name: Pictorial Stacked Chart
chart_types.best_for: Combining thematic shapes with stacked data to create more engaging visualizations of compositional data

chart_types.name: Multiple Pie Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing compositional data across different groups to identify differences in distribution patterns

chart_types.name: Multiple Donut Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing compositional data across groups with space for additional information in each center

chart_types.name: Multiple Semi Circle Donut Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing part-to-whole relationships across groups in a space-efficient format

chart_types.name: Slope Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing changes between exactly two points in time across multiple categories, emphasizing direction and magnitude of change

x+y1+y2.description: Charts visualizing ranges, intervals, or paired comparative values
x+y1+y2.suitable_for: Displaying data ranges, uncertainty, variability, or direct comparisons between paired metrics

chart_types.name: Range Area Chart
chart_types.best_for: Showing the area between upper and lower bounds over a continuous axis, visualizing data uncertainty or variability

chart_types.name: Column Range
chart_types.best_for: Displaying minimum and maximum values across categories as vertical bars, ideal for showing data ranges or variation

chart_types.name: Butterfly Chart
chart_types.best_for: Comparing two sets of values across the same categories (e.g., male vs female, before vs after), highlighting differences

chart_types.name: Span Chart
chart_types.best_for: Visualizing durations, periods, or intervals like project timelines, showing start and end points across categories

x+y+order.description: Charts showing changes in order, rank, or position across categories or time
x+y+order.suitable_for: Tracking relative position or ranking changes rather than absolute values

chart_types.name: Bump Chart
chart_types.best_for: Visualizing changes in rank position over time or ordered categories, focusing on relative standing rather than values

x+y+size.description: Charts representing three variables using position and size dimensions
x+y+size.suitable_for: Displaying relationships between three variables where two define position and one defines magnitude

chart_types.name: Bubble Chart
chart_types.best_for: Visualizing relationships between three numeric variables where position indicates two dimensions and size represents a third
